The statistic illustrates the annual growth in real GDP in the United States from 2011 to 2021 . GDP is the broadest measure of economic output and is calculated as the sum of the gross value added in all industries , including the service sector , the agricultural sector , and the industrial sector . Real GDP is expressed in constant price . It can be expressed either in real growth or in real value added terms . In 2021 , U.S. real GDP is projected to increase by approximately 0.8 percent compared to 2020 .
